com.biomatters.geneious.publicapi.utilities

Class ProgressInputStream

  • java.lang.Object
    • java.io.InputStream
      • java.io.FilterInputStream
        • com.biomatters.geneious.publicapi.utilities.ProgressInputStream
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Closeable, AutoCloseable

    public class ProgressInputStream
extends FilterInputStream
    An InputStream that reports progress to a ProgressListener and queries the ProgressListener about when to cancel, throwing an ProgressInterruptedIOException when it should cancel.

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Class and Description
      static class  ProgressInputStream.ProgressInterruptedIOException
      An InterruptedIOException that was thrown by a ProgressInputStream because its ProgressListener signaled that the operation was aborted.

                   InputStream in,
                   long size)
        Constructs an object to monitor the progress of an input stream.
        Parameters:
        progressListener - progress listener to report progress to and query for cancelling
        in - The input stream to be monitored.
        size - expected total size of the InputStream. May be 0 if unknown.

    • Method Detail

      • setSuppressFailureOnClose

        public ProgressInputStream setSuppressFailureOnClose(boolean suppressFailureOnClose)
        Sets suppressions of IOExceptions that occur when closing an InputStream. The default behaviour is to not supress them.

        It seems that very rarely on a FileInputStream on linux, close throws in IOException after successfully reading the contents of the file. Some code relies on this not happening (in particular the Piccolo sax builder which calls close on the previous InputStream next time it parses) and this parameter suppresses IOException's that occur when closing an InputStream

        Parameters:
        suppressFailureOnClose - true to suppress IOExceptions that occur when closing an InputStream.
        Returns:
        this (for convenience)

      • read

        public int read()

      • updateProgress

        protected boolean updateProgress(long bytesSoFar,
                     long size)
        Called whenever new data has been read. The default implementation of this method converts the value to a fractionComplete and calls ProgressListener.setProgress(double) and returns true if the progress listener requests the read be canceled.
        Parameters:
        bytesSoFar - the number of bytes read so far.
        size - the total number of bytes to read, which may be 0 if unknown.
        Returns:
        true if read should be canceled.
